introduction:
Hormonal balance is your body's natural rhythm. Let's tune it back to perfection.

Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome (PCOS) or Disease (PCOD) is now affecting 1 in 5 women in India. It is not just a reproductive issue; it is a metabolic disorder closely linked to Insulin Resistance. The conventional route of prescribing contraceptive pills gives you a 'withdrawal bleed', not a real period, and often masks the problem while it worsens internally.

Our PCOD/PCOS Reversal Program treats the root causes: Insulin Resistance, Chronic Inflammation, and Adrenal Stress. We help you shed the stubborn weight, clear your skin (acne), stop hair fall, and most importantly, restore your natural, ovulatory menstrual cycle.

sections.title: The Root Cause: It's Not Just About Ovaries
sections.content:
PCOS is often a symptom of a deeper metabolic chaos.

  • Insulin Resistance: High insulin levels stimulate the ovaries to produce excess Testosterone (male hormone), leading to acne, facial hair, and stopped periods.
  • Gut Health: Poor gut bacteria can lead to re-absorption of estrogen, causing hormonal dominance.
  • Stress (Cortisol): High stress steals the raw material (Progesterone) needed for a healthy cycle.

sections.title: Naturopathic Protocols for Hormonal Harmony
sections.content:
1. Seed Cycling Protocol

We guide you on using specific seeds to mimic the body's natural estrogen and progesterone phases.

  • Phase 1 (Follicular): Flax & Pumpkin seeds to boost Estrogen and clear excess hormones.
  • Phase 2 (Luteal): Sesame & Sunflower seeds to boost Progesterone and support implantation/period health.

2. Mud Packs for Pelvic Health

Applying a cold mud pack to the lower abdomen helps in reducing pelvic congestion and inflammation in the ovaries/uterus. It is highly effective for reducing period pain and regulating flow.

3. Yoga for Fertility

Certain asanas increase blood flow to the reproductive organs:

  • Baddhakonasana (Butterfly Pose): Opens up the pelvic region.
  • Surya Namaskar: Improves overall metabolism and weight loss.
  • Supta Baddhakonasana: Restorative pose for stress relief.

4. Diet Correction

A low-GI diet is non-negotiable for PCOS. Eliminating dairy and gluten is often recommended as they can be inflammatory triggers for many women with hormonal issues.

faq.question: Can I get pregnant naturally with PCOS?
faq.answer: Yes! Many of our patients conceive naturally after their cycles become regular and ovulation is restored through our program.

faq.question: Will my facial hair (hirsutism) go away?
faq.answer: As insulin levels drop and testosterone reduces, new hair growth slows down and becomes finer. Existing coarse hair may need removal, but the 'growth' stops.
